comment: For meget røg, ok til en dram. Fine nuancer ellers med noter af cognac

I picked this up at Gatwick Airport at World of Whiskies. Rosie straw color. Heavy smoke and barbecue on the nose. Very reminiscent of an Ardbeg Uigeadail, but bigger, or perhaps one of their Octomore whiskies. I feel the cognac barrels add some roundness to the peat note. I'm not picking up true fruit notes but maybe that is the barbecue I'm picking up. Although there is no age statement, the legs seem to indicate at least some age on it. Sweet smoke on the tongue at first, followed by big tobacco notes. A big long finish. Definitely benefits from the extra alcohol content. Doesn't benefit from the water at least for me. It was worth 100 bucks, and worth the premium over the Uigeadail. It's an outstanding Islay product.
Sødme i duft, behagelig røg, sødme fra cognac fade, hænger ved, røgen sidder i munden,
Fantastik kombination af røg og sødme fra sherry finish.
Nice stuff, but just a little too sharp to feel like home. Sweet and peppery smoked ham
More fruity then peaty but still quite nice.
Full bodied. Rich peat and sweetness blend nicely

A great addition to have for your palate. This 8-year old heavily peated Scotch is finished in Cognac barrels and that French oak is something quite apparent, especially in the finish. It is well balanced with tones of peat, leather, hazelnuts and a touch of citrus. 

Possible to drink neat, add a dash of water and you'll have a myriad of angles to discover in this. Can be heavy on the oak for some. Well worth the price.
One of the few smokey scotchs that I like.

Super smoky, peat, iodine, vanilla nose
Leather on the palate
Takes your breath away

This is a travel exclusive and I had to hunt this down. It is really interesting. I am not a huge peat fan but the cognac cask really offsets the peat. There are a lot of good things going on when you take a sip. It's like there is a party on my palate and EVERYONE is invited. I am still trying to figure out exactly how I feel about this but I enjoy drinking it and I will continue to do so...

향 : 향긋한 피티함
맛 : 꼬냑의 달달함, 달콤한 피티향
피니쉬 : 57.8%의 풍부함

Strong but not aggressive tasting. Very strong peaty scent, a little chemical smelling. More pleasant aftertaste. 
Decent
Peat and smoke up front, smooths out with citrus, clove, vanilla, and brine. It feels fresh at the end.
Very strong, chemically, high proof. Strong but not aggressive. I don't like it but everyone else does. Need to come back to this one when I have more experience with peaty whiskeys.
Nice. Peaty start to finish. Smooth full complex flavors

A battle between Cognac and pure Islay peat smoke. The nose hints at promises of smoke and vanilla and spice and on the tongue its a scrum.  It's like there is a party in your mouth and everyone is invited. The abv is cask strength but there is no alcohol burn or harshness which is surprising for an 8 year old. However, the abv makes its presence felt soon enough. This is some powerful whisky. It takes water really well, mellowing the smoke and opening up new flavors of butterscotch and nuts. This is a complex and powerful dram. I like it.
